1. Install on vista
2. double click icon
3. cry... your project is still due and no eclipse!

3.2.0 starts fine for me on Vista. Try a clean install.
Also I'd suggest trying 3.2.2, or one of the latest 3.3 RC builds instead of 3.2.0 on Vista.
Kevin, please follow up with this guy.

In order to run MyEclipse under Windoze Vista you MUST go to the "eclipse" directory and right click the executable there and tell it to run as Windoze XP SP 2. After this double clicking the MyEclipse icon will load just fine with the SWT stuff. Right clicking the MyEclipse icon and changing its runtime windoze version WILL NOT WORK! I guess because it is a link or something... whatever.

This sounds like it might be a bug in MyEclipse. Do you have the same problem running a vanilla Eclipse install?
The version number (3236) on the SWT library from your trace looks suspicious. If I remember correctly, my install of 3.2.0 contained libraries with version number 3232o (I'll check that when I get into the office this morning).
Does MyEclipse have a bug tracking system? I suspect they have more information about than we do about this failure.

swt libraries versioned with 3236 number were included in 3.2.2. Are you really running 3.2.0? What is the build id on the Help/About Eclipse SDK dialog? It should be something like M20070212-1330.

Eclipse 3.2.2 (M20070212-1330) was the first build that is officially supported on Vista. Running just Eclipse you should not need to change the compatibility mode. Is it because of MyEclipse that you had to do that?

marking INVALID. 
Please reopen this bug if you can reproduce this with a vanilla install of eclipse 3.2.2 or 3.3.
